Crimes.Crime_Name: Erroneous Finding of Fact in Immigration Decision
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the officer based her decision on an erroneous finding of fact without considering material evidence
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Officer failed to mention or analyze applicants' experience letters
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Credibility concerns raised but not properly addressed
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Administrative fact-finding must acknowledge and analyze relevant evidence
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Unreasonable decision due to omission of relevant evidence
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Duty of fairness breached due to lack of engagement with evidence
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Experience letters were submitted but ignored
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Denial of work permits based on insufficient knowledge and credibility
Crimes.Defendant_Response: No response detailed; decision stood on record
Crimes.Outcome: Matter remitted for redetermination by a different officer
Crimes.Remedy_Sought: Set aside decision and remit for reconsideration
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Administrative decision-making must be reasonable and fair

Crimes.Crime_Name: Work Permit Refusal under Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the officer made an erroneous finding of fact by ignoring relevant evidence
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) and Regulations
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Refusal based on credibility and inconsistency concerns
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of consideration of experience letters
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to assess all submitted evidence
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Decisions must consider all material evidence
Crimes.Application_Factor: Job qualifications based on work experience
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Applications refused due to credibility issues
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Omission of key evidence affecting fairness
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Perceived inconsistencies and lack of credibility
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to consider submitted experience letters
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Applicants not notified of document concerns
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Alleged but not proven; concerns raised without verification attempts
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Lack of notice and opportunity to respond

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the officer breached the duty of fairness by not notifying applicants of concerns about document veracity
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicants to meet eligibility criteria
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Concerns about authenticity of experience letters
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Officers must inform applicants of concerns and allow chance to respond
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure to provide notice of concerns regarding documents
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Decision found unreasonable due to unfair process
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Experience letters central to qualification assessment
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Denial without opportunity to address concerns
Crimes.Legal_Rule_Source: Common law duty of fairness and IRPA
Crimes.Defendant_Response: No indication that concerns were communicated
Crimes.Outcome: Matter remitted to different officer for redetermination
Crimes.Remedy_Sought: Set aside and remit for fair reconsideration
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Procedural fairness requires notice and opportunity to respond
